resources.string: Number of Letters Moved to End
"You can't copy yet. You haven't entered anything."
Hey! You should get PigLatin Translator by An3Enterprises.
Put a word you want in your code here.
Are you sure you want to exit PigLatin Translator?
Do not add suffix to numbers
Please do not use any special symbols other than punctuation.
Oops… Your previous text could not be loaded.

"Install Code Maker at https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=an3enterprises.codemaker. Tap on the three dot menu at the top right of the screen. Select "Enter Shared Code". Then type in the following code: "
Your shared code is invalid. Please double check you\'re typing it right.
Enter the code your friend sent you. When you enter the code, you\'ll be able to decode his messages!
With Code Maker, you can easily make a secret coded language that nobody but you and your friends will know.
A suffix is a letter or group of letters that is added to the end of every word.

The Ending Suffix is the letter or group of letters that is added to every word you type in the Encoder.

Example:

 If "ay" is the Ending Suffix

 "Hello!" → "Helloay!"
Number of Letters Moved to End

Number of Letters Moved to End is how many letters are moved from the beginning of every word to the end.

Example:

 If Number of Letters Moved To End is 1

 "Hello!" → "Elloh!".
Do Not Add Suffix to Numbers Checkbox

If you uncheck the "Do not add suffix to numbers" checkbox, then the Ending Suffix will be added to the end of numbers.

Example:

 If Number of Letters Moved to End is 0 and the Ending Phrase is "ay"

"I have 1 dog." → "Iay haveay 1ay dogay."

If you uncheck the "Do Not Move Numbers" checkbox, then a number that has more than one digit will be moved to the end depending on the Number of Letters Moved to End.

Example: 
If Number of Letters Moved to End is 1.

 "I was born in 1990." → "I asw ornb ni 9901."
